Description: (v2.5) Deploy a security VPC for a FGT & GWLB design with 8 subnets (Public, Private, Gwlb, and TgwAttach) across 2x Availability Zones.

VPCCIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for the VPC

AZForSubnet1.Description: Select an Availability Zone for the first set of subnets

AZForSubnet2.Description: Select an Availability Zone for the second set of subnets

PublicSubnet1.Description: Provide a network CIDR for PublicSubnet1

PrivateSubnet1.Description: Provide a network CIDR for PrivateSubnet1

GwlbSubnet1.Description: Provide a network CIDR for GwlbSubnet1

PublicSubnet2.Description: Provide a network CIDR for PublicSubnet2

PrivateSubnet2.Description: Provide a network CIDR for PrivateSubnet2

GwlbSubnet2.Description: Provide a network CIDR for GwlbSubnet2

TgwAttach.Description: Select Yes if you plan to attach this VPC to Transit GW with a VPC attachment, otherwise select No

TgwAttachSubnet1.Description: [Ignore if TgwAttach is No] Provide a network CIDR for TgwAttachSubnet1

TgwAttachSubnet2.Description: [Ignore if TgwAttach is No] Provide a network CIDR for TgwAttachSubnet2

TgwCreation.Description: Select Yes if you want to deploy a new Transit GW and two Transit GW Route Tables

TgwExisting.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW ID to create VPC routes to reach it

TgwExistingSecurityTgwRtb.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW RouteTable ID for the security VPC to associate to

TgwExistingSpokeTgwRtb.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW RouteTable ID that your spoke VPCs are associated with

TgwExistingSpokeTgwRtbRoute.Description: [Ignore if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide a network CIDR to create a route in your Transit GW RouteTable that your spoke VPCs are associated with

InstanceType.Description: Select the instance type for the FortiGates

CIDRForInstanceAccess.Description: Provide a network CIDR from which the FortiGate instances will be accessed

KeyPair.Description: Select a keypair to associate with the FortiGates

EncryptVolumes.Description: Select 'true' to encrypt the FortiGate instance OS and Log volumes with your account's KMS default master key for EBS.  Otherwise select false to leave unencrypted

InitS3Bucket.Description: Provide the Init S3 Bucket name, where your config files will be created  *** the bucket should exist in the same region as this deployment for successful bootstrapping ***

FortiOSVersion.Description: Select the verion of FortiOS to use (latest GA AMI will be used)

LicenseType.Description: Select the license type for the FortiGates

FortiGate1LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiGate1 (ie fgt1.lic or prefix/fgt1.lic)

FortiGate2LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiGate2 (ie fgt2.lic or prefix/fgt2.lic)

Fn::Join: logger.error('!!--> Unable to find vpce service name in response! {}'.format(response))
logger.info('--> found Gwlb IP for AZ1: {}'.format(gwlb_ip1))
logger.error('!!--> Unable to Gwlb IP for AZ1 in response! {}'.format(response))
logger.info('--> found Gwlb IP for AZ2: {}'.format(gwlb_ip2))
logger.error('!!--> Unable to Gwlb IP in response! {}'.format(response))
if gwlb_ip1_result is True and gwlb_ip2_result is True:
logger.error('!!--> Unable to modify Tgw Attachment! {}'.format(response))

SecurityGroupIngress.Description: Allow local VPC access to FGT

Fn::Join: logger.error('!!--> Unable to find AMI in response! {}'.format(response))
set allowaccess ping https ssh fgfm
set allowaccess ping https ssh fgfm
if fgt1_result is True and fgt2_result is True:

Password.Value: The instance ID of each FortiGate

VpcEndpointServiceName.Description: VPC endpoint service name, for use in spoke template

TransitGateway.Description: Transit Gateway ID, for use in spoke template

TransitGatewaySecurityRtb.Description: Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the security VPC is associated to, for use in spoke template

TransitGatewaySpokeRtb.Description: Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the spoke VPCs will associate to, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGateway.Description: Existing Transit Gateway ID, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGatewaySecurityRtb.Description: Existing Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the security VPC is associated to, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGatewaySpokeRtb.Description: Existing Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the spoke VPCs will associate to, for use in spoke template
